author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday informed the Kerala High Court that it had established from incriminating materials that senior CPI(M) leader P. Jayarajan was the “kingpin and mastermind’’ of the criminal conspiracy hatched to murder Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh worker E. Manoj.

The CBI made the submission before the Bench of Justice K.T. Sankaran and Justice K.P. Jyothindranath when an anticipatory bail petition filed by Mr. Jayarajan came up for hearing. Mr. Jayarajan, arraigned as the 25th accused, also challenged the Thalassery Sessions Court order rejecting his anticipatory bail plea in the case.

He has been charged with offences under provisions of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA). Manoj, an RSS activist, was hacked to death at Kathirur in Kannur district on September 1, 2014, allegedly by a group of CPI(M) workers. The CBI, which took over the investigation in the case, had filed a charge sheet against 19 accused in the Thalassery court in March last year.

Manoj was hacked to death at Kathirur in Kannur district on September 1, 2014, allegedly by a group of CPI(M) workers
title: ‘CPI(M) leader masterminded RSS worker’s murder’
